Author: cabera#9759
Content:
Hi I am running agama wallet 3.6b in native mode and trying to have ZEXO work for me.
1. I have both ZEX and ZEXO in my agama wallet fully synced.
2. I used import WIF key (private key) in ZEXO wallet
3. I can now see the ZEX address in my ZEXO wallet.
4. I have done a rescan of the wallet.

The problem is that ZEXO wallet is not showing any balance. Correct balance is being shown when I switch over to my old ZEX wallet.
I have tried to close down the agama wallet and restart it without any success.

Any suggest how to solve this issue?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @cabera check the ZEXO explorer, does the address have a balance?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: https://zexo.explorer.dexstats.info/

Author: cabera#9759
Content: Yes

Author: cabera#9759
Content: Explorer shows that the correct balance

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
Can you start agama with a rescan on ZEXO
If the correct key is imported it will show up

Author: cabera#9759
Content: @CHMEX what is the CLI command to do a rescan?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
You need to start the daemon with argument
-rescan

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
I believe if you use agama at  startup there are daemon parameters to select from
Use reindex

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Please try to do the following: 
1) Ensure that you control seed on which you have funds. You can doublecheck / record it by `Settings -> Recovery` option. Before next steps ensure that seed which you wrote on paper exactly match entry which showing `Recovery` feature
2) In `Settings` select `Purge all data -> click Save` (please note that only way to access your funds after it is correct seed input), uninstall app and install again, login with seed saved on step1

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: When installing the latest version the uninstall option is ticked by default. Should we uninstall first? or can we just select the re-install option. Secondly how to delete a wallet in Agama?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: it is always better to uninstall old version first before installing new version.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
`Secondly how to delete a wallet in Agama?`
how did you use Agama before? Native mode or Lite mode?
do you have backup of seed or wallet.dat ?

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: Except I have to rebuild/import a wallet that previously was setup and working. Lite mode... I have backups etc. Being confused I set up a new wallet by mistake and want it gone from the menu.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you have a backup of your seed, you don't need to delete anything apart from uninstalling old version and installing new version. once done, use the Restore wallet option and the seed you had as backup.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you want to delete an unwanted wallet file, Go to settings > Change PIN and delete the pin file

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: It's the Wallet Name request and PIN request thats confusing me... is that for old stored info? Or am I creating it anew?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you already have a seed that you want to use, select Restore wallet.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: for easily identification give a wallet file name and use a PIN/password to login

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: so, you dont' have to type your seed or WIF every time you want to use it.

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: If I reinstall without uninstalling does the old wallet and PIN remain?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes

Author: TheFalseProfit#5929
Content: Cheers. All good now!

Author: Steelrat#2421
Content: Hello, I can not see my funds in the Agama Wallet (0.3.6b) , can see it on the chain though, so it is not gone üòÑ , the wallet is saying: "unknown method blockchain adress get_balance" , changing server does no good, also socket timeout is now at 200.000 and does not work either, what else can I do?

Author: Steelrat#2421
Content: thank you in advance

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: check if you have proxy enabled in settings. if enabled, disable it and restart Agama

Author: Steelrat#2421
Content: @SHossain  there it is, thank you...
